title: Plans Underway to Bring Back Rugby Crowds
byline: Sri Lanka Rugby (SLR) is set to embark on a major transformation in its domestic league structure with plans to introduce a Grand Final to conclude the season, aligning with global rugby trends.

title: Three Afghan cricketers killed in attack: cricket board
byline: Afghanistan have pulled out of a tri-nation series with Pakistan and Sri Lanka next month after three local cricketers were killed in an attack, the country’s cricket board said on Friday.

title: South Africa storm past Sri Lanka in rain-hit World Cup encounter
byline: South Africa’s juggernaut rolled on in the Women’s World Cup as they crushed Sri Lanka by 10 wickets in a rain-marred contest in Colombo on Friday.

title: Ignored boxer Mihiran raises the bar at Clifford Cup
byline: Umayanga Mihiran was in sublime form during the 95th Clifford Cup quarter-finals of the Bantamweight (under 55kgs) as he outgunned Army veteran Piyal Dharmasena at Royal MAS Arena.  A two-time national champion, 22-year old Mihiran representing Police, produced a masterclass in controlled aggression and technical brilliance to force a stoppage in the third round.

title: Safe-haven rush pushes gold to glittering new peak in SL
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka surged to an all-time high on Friday, shattering previous records as investors worldwide flock to the precious metal amid growing economic uncertainty.

title: No legal action yet in 12-year-old National Museum artefact theft
byline: Twelve years after the theft of 221 valuable artefacts from the Colombo National Museum, the case remains unresolved, with the Attorney General’s Department yet to file charges against the accused, according to the latest audit report of the Department of National Museums.

title: Sri Lankan sisters from Australia grace Asian Colombo Sevens
byline: The stage is set for the second leg of the Asian Rugby Sevens which kicks off today at the Race Course ground in Colombo taking in both the men’s and women’s segments with two sisters from Australia likely to grab the attention of local fans like bolts from the blues.

title: Police probe after flower garland found on photo of Mirihana Police female OIC
byline: A special police investigation has been launched into an unusual incident where a flower garland was found placed around a photograph of Chief Woman Police Inspector Varuni Keshala Bogahawatta, the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Women and Children’s Bureau at the Mirihana Police Station.

title: Thailand ex-PM Abhisit reinstated as conservative party leader
byline: Thailand’s oldest political party voted on Oct 18 to reinstate as its leader a conservative ex-premier who led the country during a bloody military crackdown on “Red Shirts” protesters.

title: 23,000 MT of imported salt held at port over quality and deadline violations
byline: A stock of 22,950 metric tons of imported salt, valued at over Rs. 910 million, has been detained by Sri Lanka Customs after being found non-compliant with national standards and imported after the government’s permitted deadline, according to Customs sources.

title: Heavy rain to lash island till month-end
byline: The adverse weather condition is expected to continue across most parts of the country until the end of the month, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Three Afghan cricketers killed in attack: cricket board
byline: Afghanistan have pulled out of a tri-nation series with Pakistan and Sri Lanka next month after three local cricketers were killed in an attack, the country’s cricket board said on Friday.

title: Russian ‘cancer vaccine’ still in early stages: SL health authorities
byline: Sri Lankan Health authorities have cautioned against sensational claims surrounding Russia’s so-called cancer vaccine ‘Enteromix’, saying it remains at a pre-clinical stage and has yet to prove its effectiveness through scientific validation.

title: Fire at Dhaka airport cargo terminal forces flight delays, diversions
byline: Flights out of Bangladesh’s main airport were delayed or diverted on Saturday after a major fire broke out in the cargo terminal, officials said.

title: Man arrested with elephant pearls worth over Rs. 30Mn
byline: A man has been arrested in the indigenous village of Mahiyanganaya with a stock of elephant pearls valued at over Rs. 30 million, officials said.

title: Rain-hit Pak v NZ WC match resumes
byline: The Women’s Cricket World Cup encounter of Pakistan v New Zealand, hit by rain, resumed a short while ago at R. Premadasa Stadium

title: Pakistan to hold talks with Afghanistan in Qatar after latest strikes
byline: The Afghanistan Cricket Board told AFP that three players who were in the region for a domestic tournament were killed, revising down an earlier toll of eight.

title: Fire at Dhaka airport cargo terminal forces flight delays, diversions
byline: Flights out of Bangladesh’s main airport were delayed or diverted on Saturday after a major fire broke out in the cargo terminal, officials said.

title: Pakistan to hold talks with Afghanistan in Qatar after latest strikes
byline: The Afghanistan Cricket Board told AFP that three players who were in the region for a domestic tournament were killed, revising down an earlier toll of eight.
